videoData.title: Can we "print" smart objects?

nodes.whoTheyAre: At Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, Dan Walker is a Project Leader and Print Champion for the Chilworth site in the United Kingdom. His aim is to lead a dedicated printing team with digital, analogue and additive printing capabilities. After studying physics and astronomy at the University of Southampton, Walker started at Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany as a Research and Development scientist. He went on to pursue a PhD at the Technical University of Darmstadt in Germany on solution processed inorganic semiconductors which led him to work today on inkjet printed OLEDs (Organic Light Emitting Diodes).

videoData.description: According to technologist Dan Walker, the future is going to be printed. Well, not exactly, but many things that we today patch together or assemble, will actually come to us as complex printed objects. By loading the standard printers we use today with special inks that conduct electricity, we can print electronic circuits onto the objects, making it even easier to connect them to the Internet of Things.
